fig-text-grp.ptxt: NOTE: Put on gloves to protect your hands.

When the upper front bracket (A), the upper rear bracket (B), and the lower bracket (C) on the headlight assembly (D) are broken, it can be reinstalled using the repair brackets if it meets this criteria:

item.ptxt: To confirm which the headlight brackets are sold as repair parts, refer to the appropriate Parts Catalog.
There is no damage to the headlight assembly.
The sealing of the headlight lens and headlight housing is maintained.

s1.ptxt: Remove the front bumper; refer to the appropriate Fit/Jazz Shop Manual.
Remove the headlight assembly; refer to the appropriate Fit/Jazz Shop Manual.

Cut or grind off the damaged upper front bracket (A), upper rear bracket (B), or lower bracket (C) so that the bosses (D) on the headlight housing (E) are left as shown. After removing the damaged bracket, finish the cut area with grit sandpaper. Take care not to scratch the headlight assembly.

Install the upper front repair bracket (A), the upper rear repair bracket (B), or the lower repair bracket (C) on the bosses (D) on the headlight housing (E), then fasten it with the screws (F) provided with the repair bracket.
Reinstall the headlight assembly; refer to the appropriate Fit/Jazz Shop Manual.
Reinstall the front bumper; refer to the appropriate Fit/Jazz Shop Manual.
Adjust the headlights to local requirements; refer to the appropriate Fit/Jazz Shop Manual.
